label: The calendar year the data submission covers
A financial institution’s Legal Entity Identifier
The 5 digit derived MSA (metropolitan statistical area) or MD (metropolitan division) code
Two-letter state code
5-digit State-county FIPS code
11 digit census tract number
Indicates whether the reported loan amount exceeds the GSE (government sponsored enterprise) conforming loan limit
Derived loan product type from Loan Type and Lien Status fields for easier querying of specific records
Derived dwelling type from Construction Method and Total Units fields for easier querying of specific records
Single aggregated ethnicity categorization derived from applicant/borrower and co-applicant/co-borrower ethnicity fields
Single aggregated race categorization derived from applicant/borrower and co-applicant/co-borrower race fields
Single aggregated sex categorization derived from applicant/borrower and co-applicant/co-borrower sex fields
The action taken on the covered loan or application
Type of entity purchasing a covered loan from the institution
Whether the covered loan or application involved a request for a preapproval of a home purchase loan under a preapproval program
The type of covered loan or application
The purpose of covered loan or application
Lien status of the property securing the covered loan, or in the case of an application, proposed to secure the covered loan
Whether the covered loan or application is for a reverse mortgage
Whether the covered loan or application is for an open-end line of credit
Whether the covered loan or application is primarily for a business or commercial purpose
The amount of the covered loan, or the amount applied for
The ratio of the total amount of debt secured by the property to the value of the property relied on in making the credit decision
The interest rate for the covered loan or application
The difference between the covered loan’s annual percentage rate (APR) and the average prime offer rate (APOR) for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set
Whether the covered loan is a high-cost mortgage
The amount, in dollars, of total loan costs
The total points and fees, in dollars, charged in connection with the covered loan
The total of all itemized amounts, in dollars, that are designated borrower-paid at or before closing
The points paid, in dollars, to the creditor to reduce the interest rate
The amount, in dollars, of lender credits
The number of months after which the legal obligation will mature or terminate, or would have matured or terminated
The term, in months, of any prepayment penalty
The number of months, or proposed number of months in the case of an application, until the first date the interest rate may change after closing or account opening
Whether the contractual terms include, or would have included, a term that would cause the covered loan to be a negative amortization loan
Whether the contractual terms include, or would have included, interest-only payments
Whether the contractual terms include, or would have included, a balloon payment

Whether the contractual terms include, or would have included, any term, other than those described in Paragraphs 1003.4(a)(27)(i), (ii), and (iii) that would allow for payments other than fully amortizing payments during the loan term
The value of the property securing the covered loan or, in the case of an application, proposed to secure the covered loan, relied on in making the credit decision
Construction method for the dwelling
Occupancy type for the dwelling
Whether the covered loan or application is, or would have been, secured by a manufactured home and land, or by a manufactured home and not land
The applicant’s or borrower’s land property interest in the land on which a manufactured home is, or will be, located
The number of individual dwelling units related to the property securing the covered loan or, in the case of an application, proposed to secure the covered loan
Reported values as a percentage, rounded to the nearest whole number, of the value reported for Total Units
The gross annual income, in thousands of dollars, relied on in making the credit decision, or if a credit decision was not made, the gross annual income relied on in processing the application
The ratio, as a percentage, of the applicant’s or borrower’s total monthly debt to the total monthly income relied on in making the credit decision
The name and version of the credit scoring model used to generate the credit score, or scores, relied on in making the credit decision
The name and version of the credit scoring model used to generate the credit score, or scores, relied on in making the credit decision
